code: library(oce) data(section) ctd <- section[["station", 100]] Slim <- c(34.8, 37.0) Tlim <- c(0, 25) par(mfcol=c(2,2)) plotTS(ctd, Slim=Slim, Tlim=Tlim, eos="unesco") plotTS(ctd, Slim=Slim, Tlim=Tlim, eos="gsw") plot(ctd[["SA"]] - ctd[["salinity"]], ctd[["z"]],      xlab="Practical Salinity - Absolute Salinity", ylab="Depth [m]") plot(ctd[["CT"]] - ctd[["theta"]], ctd[["z"]],      xlab="Conservative Temp. - Potential Temp.", ylab="Depth [m]") f <- section[["CT"]] - section[["theta"]] hist(f, main="", breaks=100, xlab="CT-theta") f <- section[["SA"]] - section[["salinity"]] hist(f, main="", breaks=100, xlab="Absolute Salinity - Practical Salinity") library(oce) data("levitus", package="ocedata") SSS <- levitus$SSS dim <- dim(SSS) ll <- expand.grid(lon=levitus$longitude, lat=levitus$latitude) SA <- gsw_SA_from_SP(levitus$SSS, 0, ll$lon, ll$lat) per <- 100 * (1 - levitus$SSS / SA) imagep(levitus$longitude, levitus$latitude, per, col=oceColorsJet,        zlim=quantile(per, c(0.001, 0.999), na.rm=TRUE)) title(expression("Percent difference between " * S[A] * " and " * S[P]))

title: Gibbs Energy of Seawater, and its Derivatives — gsw_gibbs
code: library(gsw) p <- seq(0, 100, 1) SA <- rep(35, length(p)) t <- rep(-5, length(p)) ## Check the derivative wrt pressure. Note the unit change E <- gsw_gibbs(0, 0, 0, SA, t, p) # Estimate derivative from linear fit (try plotting: it is very linear) m <- lm(E ~ p) print(summary(m)) #>  #> Call: #> lm(formula = E ~ p) #>  #> Residuals: #>       Min        1Q    Median        3Q       Max  #> -0.038423 -0.013827  0.005232  0.015858  0.019788  #>  #> Coefficients: #>               Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)     #> (Intercept) -1.939e+02  3.531e-03  -54906   <2e-16 *** #> p            9.725e+00  6.100e-05  159414   <2e-16 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1 #>  #> Residual standard error: 0.01787 on 99 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared:      1,	Adjusted R-squared:      1  #> F-statistic: 2.541e+10 on 1 and 99 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16 #>  plot(p, E) abline(m)  dEdp1 <- coef(m)[2] # Calculate derivative ... note we multiply by 1e4 to get from 1/Pa to 1/dbar dEdp2 <- 1e4 * gsw_gibbs(0, 0, 1, SA[1], t[1], p[1]) ## Ratio dEdp1 / dEdp2 #>         p  #> 0.9997605

C function uses data library/gsw_data_v3_0.mat file provided GSW-Matlab source code, version 3.06-11. Unfortunately, version mat file longer displayed TEOS-10.org website.  Therefore, interests making GSW-R self-contained, copy downloaded http://www.teos-10.org/software/gsw_matlab_v3_06_11.zip 2022-05-25, .mat file stored developer/create_data directory https://github.com/TEOS-10/GSW-R, dataset used GSW-R created based .mat file. Please consult http://www.teos-10.org learn various TEOS-10 software systems.

Global SA lookup file — saar
text: dataset intended users, rather internal use within gsw package. dataset stores 1.4M lookup table defined 8.3M file src/gsw_saar_data.c C library. (.c file exceeds CRAN limitations size.)

title: Global SA lookup file — saar
text: data designed replace C elements defined src/gsw_saar_data.c: R storage list named saar, elements named C code, .e. gsw_nx etc. C storage variables allocated needed, data inserted, gsw launched. Thus, existing C library code "knows" data local storage, keeps alterations C library minimum. saar dataset created following R code. netcdf file used code comes GSW-Fortran repository (commit baa0c09ffc7ed1f74972a1a2902d8754caa5b4cb) md5 value dacb3f981e8e710ac2e83477701b3905.
code: static int	gsw_nx=91, gsw_ny=45, gsw_nz=45;     static double	longs_ref[91];     static double	lats_ref[45];     static double	p_ref[45];     static double	ndepth_ref[4095];     static double	saar_ref[184275];     static double	delta_sa_ref[184275]; library(ncdf4)   nc <- nc_open("~/git/GSW-Fortran/test/gsw_data_v3_0.nc")   ## Use as.vector() since these will all get handed into C, which does not understand matrices.   p_ref <- as.vector(ncvar_get(nc, "p_ref"))   lats_ref <- as.vector(ncvar_get(nc, "lats_ref"))   longs_ref <- as.vector(ncvar_get(nc, "longs_ref"))   ndepth_ref <- as.vector(ncvar_get(nc, "ndepth_ref"))   ndepth_ref[!is.finite(ndepth_ref)] <- -9e99   saar_ref <- as.vector(ncvar_get(nc, "SAAR_ref"))   saar_ref[!is.finite(saar_ref)] <- -9e99   delta_sa_ref <- as.vector(ncvar_get(nc, "deltaSA_ref"))   delta_sa_ref[!is.finite(delta_sa_ref)] <- -9e99   saar <- list(gsw_nx=gsw_nx, gsw_ny=gsw_ny, gsw_nz=gsw_nz,                longs_ref=longs_ref, lats_ref=lats_ref, p_ref=p_ref, ndepth_ref=ndepth_ref,                saar_ref=saar_ref, delta_sa_ref=delta_sa_ref)   save(saar, file="saar.rda")   tools::resaveRdaFiles("saar.rda")   nc_close(nc)

title: gsw 1.1-0
text: update based C code https://github.com/TEOS-10/GSW-C (release v3.06-16-0, commit 657216dd4f5ea079b5f0e021a4163e2d26893371) .mat data file https://github.com/TEOS-10/GSW-Matlab (commit 38c9635d6fd93e74c2648e4ee23cec49c1f58530). necessary make changes within-documentation test suite, listed ; MRD stands Mean Relative Difference values previous CRAN release gsw, version 1.0-6 released 2021-07-07. gsw_rho_second_derivatives()$rho_SA_p: MRD 0.4 gsw_rho_second_derivatives_wrt_enthalpy()$rho_SA_SA: MRD 1e-3 gsw_specvol_second_derivatives()$specvol_SA_p: MRD 0.2 gsw_specvol_second_derivatives_wrt_enthalpy()$specvol_SA_SA: MRD 3e-4 gsw_thermobaric()$rb: MRD 0.04

title: gsw 1.0-7
text: Update GSW-C 2021-07-14, github commit bad2c9e4e154597ce563aaaf3ce09b1c52a2ab46. change existing functions GSW-R. Add gsw_SP_salinometer(). Add gsw_o2sol(). Add gsw_o2sol_SP_pt().

title: gsw 1.0-6
text: CRAN release: 2021-07-07 Update GSW-C 2021-07-06, github commit 9c10670e89fce906da2cebce3399d73c054e769e. Remove dependency ‘testthat’ package. gsw_z_from_p() gsw_p_from_z() gain parameters geo_strf_dyn_height sea_surface_geopotential. Relax gsw_geo_strf_dyn_height() test, since values tied new Matlab interpolation scheme incorporated GSW-C.
